alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 5:47PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henry, southwestern Clay and northwestern Early Counties through 730 PM EDT/630 PM CDT/... At 647 PM EDT/547 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Abbeville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Newville, Haleburg, Shorterville, Barnes, Hardwickburg, Capps, Hayes, Murphy Station, Graball, Dancey, Miller, Abbeville Municipal A/P, Willis Crossroads and Balkum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
